text: Good morning. Please place your bags on the belt and step through the metal detector.
Good morning. Sure, here you go.
Do you have any liquids, gels, or electronics in your carry-on?
Yes, I have a water bottle and my laptop.
Please take out your laptop and place it in a separate bin. The water bottle needs to be empty or discarded.
Oh, I didn't know about the water. Can I drink it here?
Yes, you can finish it here or pour it out in that trash can over there.
Okay, I'll pour it out. Here's my laptop in the bin.
Thank you. Please remove your jacket, belt, and shoes and place them in the bins as well.
Do I really need to take off my shoes?
Yes, all footwear must be removed unless you have TSA PreCheck.
Alright, here they are.
Now please step through the metal detector with your arms raised.
Like this?
Perfect. You can step forward.
Beep beep beep.
Sir, the detector went off. Do you have anything metal in your pockets?
Oh, I forgot about my keys and phone. Sorry about that.
No problem. Please place them in this bin and step through again.
Okay, going through now.
Great, you're all clear. Please collect your belongings from the belt.
Thank you. Where do I put my shoes back on?
You can use those benches right past the security area.
Perfect, thanks for your help.
You're welcome. Have a safe flight.
Thank you, you too.
Next passenger, please step forward.
Excuse me, I think I left my phone in the bin.
Let me check for you. What does it look like?
It's a black smartphone with a blue case.
Ah, here it is. Please be more careful with your belongings.
I will, thank you so much. I really appreciate it.
No worries. Gate information is on the departure boards ahead.
Got it, thanks again.
